summary: That night Sansa dreamt of Joffrey on the throne, with herself seated beside him in a gown of woven gold. She had a crown on her...
caption:
That night Sansa dreamt of Joffrey on the throne,
with herself seated beside him in a gown of woven gold.
She had a crown on her head,
and everyone she had ever known came before her,
to bend the knee and say their courtesies.

reblog.comment:

to bend the knee and say their courtesies.

summary: the weirdest anti sansa comment of the day is that we can’t compare her to dany because sansa never has people relying on her....
body:
the weirdest anti sansa comment of the day is that we can’t compare her to dany because sansa never has people relying on her. first of all show sansa started preparing to store food including extra sacks because people fleeing the night king might not have time to bring food with them. she dealt with what was essentially a coup calmly without harming anyone. she kept the loyalty of the vale lords and she got rid of littlefinger who was one of the most dangerous people in westeros. in comparison dany destroyed wagons of food, killed thousands senselessly (she didn’t even occupy the reach. she just burnt an army almost completely and returned to dragonstone). she needed to be talked down from attacking king’s landing and she didn’t raise a finger to help her allies (she attacked the lannister army because they were taking the food, not because they killed olenna). sansa knew cersei could not be trust or underestimated, something dany does repeatedly that season. arya threatened to skin sansa alive and faced no repercussions, tyrion told dany she needs to think of her heir and she accused him of being preoccupied with her death. even in meereen, dany crucified 163 masters, some of whom were blameless when it came to the crime she was punishing them for including hizdahr’s father. she executed a former slave for killing a son of the harpy then she killed noble men to intimidate hizdahr into marrying her. can you imagine sansa doing that, just to quell a rebellion? dany’s marriage, threats and executions all fail. in fact the markets only start trading when tyrion intervened.

while book sansa hasn’t been queen, we know enough about her character to know how she would rule. she would never rely on fear alone for example. when the bread riots happened, sansa understood that the people were starving. she wouldn’t think of them as lacking morals so much as lacking food. she is a natural diplomat and prefers to find solutions to problems without resorting to violent. compare sansa’s time as acting lady of the eyrie- she took care of her sick cousin, was in charge of the day to day running of the castle, organised a tourney, etc all in a short amount of time. she doesn’t isolate herself from the people around her or think herself above them. 

sure sansa hasn’t faced the problems dany faced (yet) but i don’t understand people who act like sansa would be incapable of doing well. it doesn’t make any sense.

tags: just bc you cant find someone to ship her with doesnt change the fact that shes got a love arc lol
summary: I don’t trust ppl who say they want Sansa to be happy and theorize that she’ll never marry. Or that she’ll raise someone else’s...
body:
I don’t trust ppl who say they want Sansa to be happy and theorize that she’ll never marry. Or that she’ll raise someone else’s kid EWW

Like she’s got a love arc Susan? Just bc the men of Westeros are trash doesn’t mean she has abandoned all notion of love.

How many of us have been disillusioned in love? Doesn’t make us want it any less, we just want to find the right person.

Sansa deserves love and trust, to be valued and respected. And there’s one person left in the show who can give her all of that and more… and even if they don’t happen, Sansa will find true love!!

She could be the matriarch of the new Stark generations to come (as well as Arya, who also deserves love trust happiness and respect)

So in conclusion Sansa will marry and have starklings…

body:
*at the mall*

Bran: Excuse me? I lost my siblings. Can I please make an announcement?

Cashier: Of course.

Bran: *leans into mic* Goodbye you little shits.

blog.title: everything else just melts away
blog.description: "all the elements in your body were forged many, many millions of years ago in the heart of a far away star that explosed and died. that explosion scattered those elements across the desolations of deep space, until, eventually, they came together to make you. you are unique in the universe." - doctor who. marie; taurus, istj. blarke is my core, olicity trash, bitter queen. love girls on tv, pro-girls unity. atla/tlok hoe. waiting for the doctor. samwise gamgee saved middle earth. daensa is endgame, & sansa and dany are both queens ; protect the dragons (and the direwolves). sam winchester and jack kline are the softest. korra is bae. thor is the strongest avenger. mcu/dc(tv), lotr, got, spn. [ship and let ship]

title: What if
body: Cersei is kidnapping both Sansa and Arya ? It would explain why Arya is running in the trailer, trying to escape. This is not the dead she’s looking forward to see right ? Cersei said she wanted to recover what belongs to her… Since season 1x09, Sansa and Arya were hers. She lost both. And want to take them back. What do you think ?

blog.title: As strong as my lady mother
blog.description: Side blog for all my Sansa/Catelyn/Elia love. Critical of show!Dany but still like book!Dany. Tully Loyalist. Pro Northern Independence. Book Jon >>> Show Jon. I track #courtesyismyarmor and #daughterofrivers

summary: Also, I can't get over the Princess scenes in Ralph Breaks the Internet. I kinda want to do some art of asoiaf women in cute...
body:
Also, I can’t get over the Princess scenes in Ralph Breaks the Internet. I kinda want to do some art of asoiaf women in cute casual wear like that, with graphic shirts related to their house words or personalities. What would their shirts say?

For Dany, I love “My children have scales” or “🐲 Mummy” like furmoms wear.

Elia, something related to the sun?

Ashara- Shine Bright Like a 🌠

Margaery- 🌹Natural Beauty 🌹

I thought of Arya’s list done the way Ariel’s Gadgets & Gizmos shirt is but I don’t want to really define her by her vengeance.

And there’s so many Sansa ideas I’m overwhelmed!

blog.name: fortunatelylori
blog.title: Thoughts on the verge
blog.description:
Pretty much Game of Throne and Jonsa all day, every day. 
Avatar and header by @ragekitn

summary: Is it possible that the reason Sansa is getting an amour is so that if she’s more protective and wears it at the start of s8 but...
question: Is it possible that the reason Sansa is getting an amour is so that if she’s more protective and wears it at the start of s8 but gradually become more open as the season goes on, the change would be more obvious ? Like maybe her dress would gradually become more ‘open’ and the armor she wore would emphasize this change in her character?
answer:
Hey, nonnie!

I’ve seen this argued a lot so maybe … Honestly GOT costumes are really not an area I’m particularly versed in and I’ve also hated every single costume that has been revealed for season 8. 

That’s scaley dress that is supposed to be Sansa’s armor dress doesn’t look like anything special to me but again considering my dislike of all the costumes until now, I’m not sure I’m the best person to talk about this. 

The only thing I’m truly invested in when it comes to Sansa’s costumes is how that is reflected in her actual narrative arc and my fear with the armor dress is that it’s going to keep me locked out of her POV for even longer during season 8 and I was already frustrated by that all through season 6 and 7. I wish the Ds would just cut out the bullshit and allow me to get to know their version of Sansa better, particularly post-Ramsay because while I can take educated guesses about her, there’s far too much that they’re keeping hidden. And that’s not good storytelling to me nor will it help Sansa, the character, become more widely accepted by the audience. 

So my antipathy of the armor dress is, in many ways, fulled by my dislike of this narrative choice. As such, there is no way that this costume choice could ever be presented to me where I would think of it positively or go out of my way to analyze. 

Thanks for the ask and sorry I couldn’t be more helpful!

That’s scaley dress that is supposed to be Sansa’s armor dress doesn’t look like anything special to me but again considering my dislike of all the costumes until now, I’m not sure I’m the best person to talk about this. 

The only thing I’m truly invested in when it comes to Sansa’s costumes is how that is reflected in her actual narrative arc and my fear with the armor dress is that it’s going to keep me locked out of her POV for even longer during season 8 and I was already frustrated by that all through season 6 and 7. I wish the Ds would just cut out the bullshit and allow me to get to know their version of Sansa better, particularly post-Ramsay because while I can take educated guesses about her, there’s far too much that they’re keeping hidden. And that’s not good storytelling to me nor will it help Sansa, the character, become more widely accepted by the audience. 

So my antipathy of the armor dress is, in many ways, fulled by my dislike of this narrative choice. As such, there is no way that this costume choice could ever be presented to me where I would think of it positively or go out of my way to analyze. 

Thanks for the ask and sorry I couldn’t be more helpful!

blog.name: iheartgot
blog.title: IHEARTGOT
blog.description:
IHEARTGOT is dedicated to the HBO television series Game of Thrones, which is based on the A Song of Ice and Fire novels written by George R. R. Martin, and its cast. We update daily to bring you the latest pictures, edits, gifs and more of the show and the books. 
This is NOT a spoiler-free blog.
We track #iheartgot.

tags: a song of ice and fire

summary: In the new interview both Sophie and Maisie don't sound positive about the ending. Especially Sophie. Sound like Emilia's...
question: In the new interview both Sophie and Maisie don't sound positive about the ending. Especially Sophie. Sound like Emilia's reaction on emmys
answer:
Asked by news.com.au if they were personally satisfied with their characters’ fates, Turner and Williams both paused before uttering one or two “hmmms”.

Then, in a revealing comment, Williams said: “Of course. But I think it doesn’t matter which way it went, it would just make yourself feel sad if you were negative about what happened to you.

“It’s like tough luck, we filmed it now. That’s the end.”

Then Turner jumped in and said: “I’m at peace with it. That’s a good way to say it. We’ll say it like that from now — I’m at peace with my ending.” 

It’s not wholly positive but it’s not negative either. Compare that to what Emilia said recently.

Emilia said once she heard what happens to her character, she lost all sense of direction and walked through London for “three hours, aimlessly.”

She added, “It might as well have been raining and I would’ve just walked in it not knowing what to do.” Plus, there were “loads of tears” and wine on her end. “That was the moment I realized that alcohol can also be a depressant,” she said. “I was kind of nursing a glass of wine, going, ‘I don’t know why I’m not getting any happier from this.’”

From what I can tell, there are aspects of Sansa and Arya’s story that Sophie and Maisie might not agree with. Meanwhile Emilia is just really sad.

summary: That ship is mainly about Stannis deserving a younger more beautiful more fertile more understanding less crazy wife who can do...
question: That ship is mainly about Stannis deserving a younger more beautiful more fertile more understanding less crazy wife who can do pr and diplomacy for him. Not sure what's in it for Sansa.
answer: Exactly. I love Stannis but he is a trash husband to Selyse. I don’t know what told people that he is a feminist who treats women right. People who ship this are too cowardly to appreciate Stannis/Melisandre.

title: Prologue
body:
It all starts today, the beginning of the new fashion blog meant for those who are known as nerds, as geeks, as obsessive fangirls, as weirdos and losers, and hopeless romantics. This is a fashion blog not like any other. This is blog meant to celebrate the thugs we love. This blog meant to celebrate the women who are I afraid to be nerds, unafraid to admit they like Sansa Stark, that they are a fan of David Bowie, that they’ve watched Gilmore Girls three times all the way through, those who understand what R+L=J means, for those who love fashion and fandoms. This is the blog, The Nerdy Fashionista, dedicates who both nerds and fashionistas (so original right?).

This blog shall feature weekly posts about fashion and fangirls. Posts about how to achieve your favorite characters look, a look back at the costumes of your favorite shows, where to buy nerdy merchandise, and how to be a proud nerdy fashionista.

Our story begins here, shall it be a wonderful journey to the end.
